title: Radiators
excerpt: where radiators breathe raggedly, / bleating like sheep and / my breath coils in corners
fullText:
where radiators breathe raggedly,
bleating like sheep and
my breath coils in corners - a
soft-bellied thing
seeking refuge.

There we press palms one to the other -
one & again open to the pipes,
to warm hum beneath the asbestos.

Here and the hall light rocks heel toe
subtly, imagining theirself the
harbormaster, as we observe them
guiding houseflies to their minor deity.
